newsitem.title: USA: Conn. House passes health reform bill - report.
newsitem.headline: Conn. House passes health reform bill - report.

text.p: Connecticut's House of Representatives on Thursday passed a bill designed to help would-be patients choose a health maintenance organization (HMO), Hartford Courant reported on Friday.
The bill, passed by a 144-1 vote, is the closest Connecticut has come to regulating the quality of treatment delivered by managed care plans.
The bill is expected to be approved because it also has substantial support in the Senate, the Courant said.
About 1.4 million Connecticut residents are insured through some sort of managed care plan.
Some lawmakers have voiced concerns that the bill was an example of over-regulation. But they said they still supported it because they recognized that improvements in patient care were necessary.

The bill represents a compromise between the state's powerful insurance industry, which opposes regulation of managed care, and physician and consumer groups who argue that managed care detracts from the quality of healthcare.
